External_Reference.reference_text: Yingst, R.A., M.E. Schmidt, and R.C.F. Lentz, Understanding Mars at the microscale by imaging terrestrial analogs: The handlens atlas, Lunar Planet. Sci. Conf.., 38th, Abs. 1130, 2007.

Instrument.name: Canon EOS Digital Rebel XT
Instrument.description: The Canon EOS Digital Rebel XT, also known as the Canon EOS 350D, is a digital single-lens reflex (DSLR) camera released in 2005. It features an 8.0-megapixel CMOS sensor, a 9-point autofocus system, and a 2.0-inch LCD screen. The Rebel XT is known for its compact design and user-friendly interface, making it a popular choice for beginner and intermediate photographers. It also offers a range of manual controls, allowing users to experiment with settings for creative photography.
